paper_title.en: An extended model for the mobility edge carrier transport

description.en: The carrier transport property near the mobility edge is discussed on the basis of the renormalization group equation, in which the inelastic scattering effect is phenomenologically taken into account. The Q-function, Q = (e/k(B))S(T) + In sigma(T), where S(T) denotes the thermopower and sigma(T) the conductivity, is found to be virtually proportional to the reciprocal temperature, reproducing the experimentally observed Q-function behavior as the classical long-ranged potential fluctuation model does. We briefly argue implications from the temperature dependence of the Q-function for the band edge carrier mean free path as well as the width of the localized states. (C) 2004 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

Correlation between microstructure and photovoltaic performance of polycrystalline silicon thin film solar cells

description.en: Intrinsic polycrystalline silicon (poly-Si) thin films have been prepared by plasma enhanced chemical vapor deposition at a very high excitation frequency (100 MHz) for the development of p-i-n junction solar cells. The correlation between poly-Si microstructure and photovoltaic performance of poly-Si solar cells has been investigated as a function of deposition parameters such as deposition pressure, SiH4 flow rate and SiH4 concentration. It is found that the poly-Si microstructure including crystalline volume fraction. X-c, and crystallographic orientation is closely related to the atomic hydrogen flux during film growth, which is evidenced by plasma diagnostics in the in situ measurement of optical emission spectroscopy. Basically, with an increase in X-c, open circuit voltage tends to decrease, while poly-Si with X-c > 50% and (220) preferential orientation is essential for high short circuit current. Based on these results. the role of poly-Si microstructure in the photovoltaic performance of poly-Si solar cells is discussed.

Reduction of infrared response of CdS/CdTe thin-film solar cell with decreased thickness of photovoltaic active layer

description.en: Reduction of the infrared response is found in the CdS/CdTe thin-film solar cells with a decrease in the thicknesses of the photovoltaic active layers from 16 to 3 mum. The reduction is concluded to be mainly due to an increase in recombinations of photogenerated electrons in the p-layer caused by the unintentionally increased Cu acceptor concentration. A simple model for the depth profile of the donor and acceptor densities is proposed to explain that the acceptor concentration at the n-p junction can be unintentionally increased with a decrease in the thicknesses of the photovoltaic active layers, even if the process parameters for the Cu-doping are unchanged. (C) 2001 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

Interfacial mixed-crystal layer in CdS/CdTe heterostructure elucidated by electroreflectance spectroscopy

description.en: Electroreflectance (ER) spectroscopy has been carried out on the CdS/CdTe thin-film solar cells to reveal the CdS/CdTe interfacial properties, which is believed to play a crucial role in determining the photovoltaic performances. The ER feature at around 1.46 eV is to be ascribed as due to the mixed-crystal CdTe0.95S0.05 layer unintentionally formed at the CdS/CdTe interface during CdTe deposition on CdS. Comparing the ER spectrum with the quantum efficiency (QE) response of the solar cell, the indication is that the n-p junction locates itself in the mixed-crystal layer, because no pronounced response due to the CdTe layer is observed in the ER spectrum whereas it is observed in the QE spectrum.

paper_title.en: Photocurrent multiplication in amorphous Si crystalline Si heterojunction

description.en: A photocurrent multiplication factor over 20 has been observed an a new a-Si:H/c-Si heterojunction structure fabricated on a c-Si substrate under the deeply reverse biased voltage, In contrast, any marked increase in the dark current is not found on the photodiode, and the signal-to-noise ratio is achieved to be around 170. The spectral response indicates that the photocurrent multiplication factor gets smaller for illumination wavelengths, Photoconversion characteristics show that the photocurrent is proportional to the illumination intensity in the reverse bias voltage region in which multiplication occurs. A possible mechanism for the photocurrent multiplication involving the avalanche multiplication is discussed through various experiments regarding the photocurrent characteristics.

paper_title.en: Light-induced change in material properties of amorphous silicon:Defect creation and structural change

description.ja: 20年余の長きにわたり関連研究者を悩ませ,楽しませてきたアモルファスシリコンにおける光劣化現象に,その解明と抑止策開発の可能性を秘めた新しい局面が訪れた.光照射による欠陥生成にはシリコンネットワークの広範囲にわたる構造変化が伴われていることが示唆され,膜構造と光劣化との掛け橋を通しての材料制御に期待が寄せられる.
